lead_paragraph: In a particularly ferocious version of a divide playing out nationally, state lawmakers and city leaders are fighting over who should have the authority to set wage policy.

headline.print_headline: When a State Balks at a City’s Minimum Wage
headline.main: When a State Balks at a City’s Minimum Wage

snippet: In a particularly ferocious version of a divide playing out nationally, state lawmakers and city leaders are fighting over who should have the authority to set wage policy.
abstract: Birmingham, Ala, officials and residents decry Alabama Legislature's efforts to scrap $10.10 minimum hourly wage approved by city in August 2015, in showdown over whether state or city should set local wage policy; dispute reflects ongoing debate in several states, typically pitting liberal urban centers against conservative state legislatures; outcome is expected to have national repercussions.
